general_advisory: The overall crop condition is Normal. Dry weather may prevail over the district of Puri for the next five days with clear to partly cloudy sky conditions. Wind speeds will be within 27-31 km/h. Daily maximum and minimum temperatures are likely to remain between 33-34°C and 26-28°C respectively.

advisory: Management of Yellow Stem Borer: Spray Fipronil 5%SC @ 400ml/acre or Flubendiamide 20% WG @ 50g/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC @ 60ml /acre or Chromafenozide 80%WP @ 50g/acre
Blast Disease Management: Spray Hexaconazole 5 % SC @ 400-ml/acre or Azoxystrobin 18.2% + Difenoconazole 11.4 % S.C @ 200-ml/acre or Tebuconazole 50%+ Trifloxystrobin 25 % WG @ 80-gram/acre
Pointed gourd is at flowering and fruiting stage. Don’t go for weeding.
After harvesting of onion, cut the tops leaving 2.0-2.5 cm above bulb. The harvested bulb should be dried in a well-ventilated concrete floored room.
For long term storage of chilli, first pick the ripened chilli fruits from plants and shade dry for 3 to 4 days.
Summer sunflower crop is at pre-flowering stage. Spray 2-3 g Borax per litre water.
Tobacco Caterpillar Management: Dust with Chlorpyriphos 1.5% D @ 10 kg around the field.
Tobacco Caterpillar Management: Dust with Chlorpyriphos 1.5% D @ 10 kg around the field.
Early Shoot Borer: Spray Fipronil 5% SC @ 600ml/acre or Profenophos 50% EC @ 400ml/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5 % SC @ 150-ml/acre
Brinjal shoot and fruit borer Management: Install 20 nos. of pheromone trap having Leucin lure per acre.
Mango hopper control: Spray Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 5 ml/15 litre of water or Thiamethoxam 25% W.G @ 3ml/15 litre of water or Acetamiprid 20% S.P. @ 4g /15litre of water.
